case_title: M/S. PIONEER STEEL MILLS LIMITED, LAHORE vs COLLECTORATE OF SALES TAX, LAHORE
appellant: M/S. PIONEER STEEL MILLS LIMITED, LAHORE

accussed_details.name: Chief Executive of M/S. Pioneer Steel Mills Limited
allegation: Failure to pay sales tax amounting to Rs. 1949425/-
Issuance of zero-rated invoices without compliance
Non-compliance with Section 131 of Customs Act, 1969

complaint_summary: The appellant failed to pay sales tax on zero-rated invoices issued for goods supplied to Azad Jammu and Kashmir, claiming exemption under Sections 3 and 4 of the Sales Tax Act, 1990.
investigation_summary: Sales Tax Audit Division detected zero-rated invoices valuing Rs. 15595391/- for goods supplied to Azad Jammu and Kashmir without paying sales tax. Show-cause notice was issued demanding evaded tax and penalties.
judgment_summary: The appeal was dismissed due to non-compliance with export procedures under Customs Act, 1969. Penalty reduced from Rs. 874713/- to Rs. 200,000/- and personal penalty of Rs. 50,000/- on Chief Executive waived.
punishment: Penalty reduced to Rs. 200,000/-; personal penalty waived.
legal_arguments: Appellant argued Azad Jammu and Kashmir is a foreign territory, exempting goods from sales tax under Sections 3 and 4 of Sales Tax Act, 1990.
Respondent argued sales tax was applicable as export formalities under Customs Act, 1969 were not completed.
key_issues: Applicability of Sales Tax Act, 1990 to Azad Jammu and Kashmir
Compliance with export procedures under Customs Act, 1969

legal_terms.Zero-rated invoices: Invoices exempt from sales tax under specific conditions.
legal_terms.Export compliance: Adherence to legal procedures for exporting goods.

words_and_phrases.Zero-rating: Tax exemption for goods exported under specific conditions.
words_and_phrases.Foreign territory: A region not considered part of the taxing jurisdiction.

summary_vector_notes: The case revolves around the applicability of sales tax on goods supplied to Azad Jammu and Kashmir. The appellant argued exemption under Sales Tax Act, 1990, claiming Azad Jammu and Kashmir as a foreign territory. The court dismissed the appeal due to non-compliance with export procedures under Customs Act, 1969, reducing penalties imposed.
